title: figural cameos - mid-1800s
content:
Hi,

Can you please assist me with identifying current fonts that closely resemble those used in these figural cameos from the mid to late 1800s? I'm really just trying to identify a short list of fonts are similar to those that were typically used during that time for these pieces that were made from engraved brass metal dies.

If you can also please provide information on where I can find these brass flourishes, curves, ribbons etc. that would be very helpful as well.

For those interested, the collection that includes these beautiful pieces is located here:

[http://www.sheaff-ephemera.com/list/figural-cameos/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150320042342/http:/www.sheaff-ephemera.com/list/figural-cameos/ "http://www.sheaff-ephemera.com/list/figural-cameos/")

I'm looking through the type specimens in the following location but thought I'd ask for assistance here as well.

[http://opentype.info/blog/2008/02/18/type-specimen/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150320042342/http:/opentype.info/blog/2008/02/18/type-specimen/ "http://opentype.info/blog/2008/02/18/type-specimen/")

Thanks so much for any help with this.

Joshua

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150320042342im_/http:/typophile.com/files/douglassmoore150_6682.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150320042342im_/http:/typophile.com/files/edmands150_6322.jpeg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150320042342im_/http:/typophile.com/files/kimball150_6022.jpeg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150320042342im_/http:/typophile.com/files/blumenthalschina150_3832.jpeg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150320042342im_/http:/typophile.com/files/schaeffersaddle150_3995.jpeg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150320042342im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ddwright150_5023.jpeg)
author: jjdewtt

comments.content:
Can anyone help identify some of these fonts? Thanks.

Josh

Perhaps you might consider splitting your request into several separate ones.  
So lets look at the first image.  
This was probably all done by hand as a "wood engraving." In this system the fonts are actually carved lettering.  
But they are based on designs that were familiar to the engraver.  
From top to bottom here some similar typefaces from the era that have been digitized.  
DOUGLASS MOORE'S  
Thorowgood  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/thorowgood/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150320042342/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/thorowgood/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/thorowgood/")  
UPHOLSTERY, PAPER HANGING  
Notification JNL  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/notification/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150320042342/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/notification/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/notification/")  
WINDOW SHADE &  
MLB Tuscan:  
 [http://www.dafont.com/mlb-tuscan.font?fpp=100&text=WINDOWSHADE%26](http://web.archive.org/web/20150320042342/http:/www.dafont.com/mlb-tuscan.font?fpp=100&text=WINDOWSHADE%26 "http://www.dafont.com/mlb-tuscan.font?fpp=100&text=WINDOWSHADE%26")  
CARPET STORE  
Typesetter JNL  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/typesetter/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150320042342/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/typesetter/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/typesetter/")  
7thStNo538  
H&FJ Numbers, Indicia  
 [http://www.typography.com/fonts/numbers/styles/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150320042342/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/numbers/styles/ "http://www.typography.com/fonts/numbers/styles/")  
etc., etc.  
Don
